subject: running a single JUnit  test in Eclipse

I have a test class with two methods, each prefixed with @Test.  In 
Eclips=
e I right-click on one of these methods and select "Run As Unit 
Test".  It=
 runs both methods, not just the one I clicked on.  This is 
using the JUni=
t that comes with Eclipse Ganymede out of the box.

Is this how it supposed=
 to work?  I was expecting it to run only the 
one method on which I right-=
clicked.  Is my expectation incorrect?

I'm working on a custom Runner.  If=
 the user does what I did above, I 
see how the test runner gets notified o=
f the class, but not the name of 
the method.  I've seen some JUnit 4 docs =
talking about filtering, so I 
thought maybe the JUnit framework would look=
 through the Description 
object returned by the runner and only execute th=
e method which the 
user right-clicked.  The class JUnit4TestMethodReferenc=
e does save a 
Description object that contains the method name, but I don'=
t see where 
that is used.  Am I missing something?

-Sam
